name: Creamy Cajeta Ice Cream
description: Back when I first developed my recipe for cajeta, I stumbled onto this ice cream as a way to polish off my infinite supply of leftovers. "Leftover" cajeta may not be a thing in your world, but it's well worth making a batch for the sole purpose of churning up this silky eggless ice cream.
recipeIngredient: 7 ounces milk (3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons; 195g); any percentage will do
7 ounces heavy cream (3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons; 195g)
1/2 ounce vanilla extract or dark rum (1 tablespoon; 15ml)

recipeInstructions.text: After preparing Cajeta Casera according to the recipe, whisk in milk, cream, and vanilla or rum. Refrigerate until cold, at least 4 hours or up to 1 week. Churn in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's directions (see note). This ice cream can be frozen up to 1 month in an airtight container with a layer of plastic wrap pressed firmly against the surface.
